newsitem.title: PERU: Disney sees $20 mln from Peru sales in 1998 -paper.
newsitem.headline: Disney sees $20 mln from Peru sales in 1998 -paper.

text.p: Entertainment company Walt Disney Co expects $20 million in 1998 from product sales in Peru, with an average 30 percent annual growth for the next five years, local newspaper El Comercio said Tuesday.
The paper quoted Erik Holmquist, representative of Disney in Peru, saying those projections were part of an expansion program throughout the region.

"In Latin America, Disney had a reputation for a product not very accessible to the majority," he said. "But the idea is that people will see our products as something that can be bought in any store at a convenient price."
Walt Disney Co Peru formally started its operations here in April 1996.
